oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Marine Corps Recruiting Station inspection, Nashville, Tennessee, 1941 March 07
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pictured: “Col. Frank C. Halford, officer in charge of the Southern Recruiting Division of the United States Marine Corps, made a brief tour of inspection of the local recruiting activity here yesterday. Colonel Halford reported that he was favorably impressed with the outlook for recruiting in this section. Colonel Halford is shown above, seated, discussing the local situation with Comm. F. R. Haselton, local medical officer, left, and Capt. S. F. Drew, officer in charge of the Nashville Recruiting Station.” Source: Nashville Banner, March 8th, 1941. Forms part of Record Group 412, Photographs Collection. 1 photograph negative : b & w ; 4 x 5 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States. Marine Corps--Recruiting, enlistment, etc.
